episodes.title: Spiritual Teacher Teal Swan's Ritual Abuse Story Investigated
episodes.description: Spiritual teacher Teal Swan claims that she was a part of a satanic cult, and was ritually tortured, and emotionally abused for thirteen years, starting at age six. She has been heavily questioned by those who have researched her story due to her inconsistent storytelling, timeline discrepancies, and improbable claims. This video takes a close look into the numerous claims Teal has made about her story. For more on Teal's ritual abuse story, visit: www.tealswanexposed.com/satanic-ritual-abuse

episodes.title: "Spiritual Teacher" Teal Swan's Lust For Fame
episodes.description:
Accompanying Article: https://bit.ly/2IJp7li — Cult Warning Sign: Teal Swan’s Love of Admiration – the evidence. Genuine celebrities working in the entertainment industry, don’t tend to refer to themselves as “celebrities”. But Teal, the self-proclaimed “leader of the new age”, does. She frequently describes herself as one, even using the hashtag #celebrity on her Instagram posts. She loves reminding her followers of her “fame”. Her followers are her “fans”, her community is her “entourage” and her workshops are “performances.”

www.tealswanexposed.com

episodes.title: Teal Swan's Epic Escape From 13 Years of Ritual Abuse
episodes.description:
"Spiritual teacher" Teal Swan recounts three different versions of her escape from 13 years of physical and emotional abuse from being in two cults. One would think she would remember how she escaped right? It's a pretty big deal.

www.tealswanexposed.com/ritual-abuse-story

episodes.title: Teal Swan's - Mirror Event - Universal Reflector Is Here! But...
episodes.description:
Accompanying Article: https://bit.ly/2JlAjWJ — "Spiritual teacher" Teal Swan claims she is a “Universal Reflector” for her upcoming event called “The Mirror”. This self-proclamation, is in addition to the already exhaustive list of grandiose titles she has bestowed upon herself. Teal has a history of using these titles in lieu of any valid credentials in psychology. She is presumably using this “reflector” label to give credence to her mind-reading guru act.

_____________________

episodes.title: Teal Swan's Self Proclaimed Titles of Exaltation
episodes.description:
Accompanying Article: https://bit.ly/2uMYnP2 | These are not all of Teal Swan's self-proclaimed titles! She has a penchant for applying many grandiose titles for herself, and by doing so, she exalts herself... just like a cult leader. If Teal applied only a handful of titles, it's likely no one would raise an eyebrow, however, when this is combined with the many other traits Teal displays, then it becomes problematic. The danger with this lack of humility and exaltation, is that it reinforces the cult leader and follower dynamic. 

Read the accompanying article here:
http://www.tealswanexposed.com/2018/03/28/teal-swan-grandiose-titles/

episodes.title: Teal Swan: The Suicide Catalyst - Disturbing Compilation - Fake Fraud Scam
episodes.description:
Learn More: https://www.tealswanexposed.com/suicide | Dozens of clips, compiled into one video, covering "spiritual teacher" Teal Swan's preoccupation with death and suicide. “Spiritual teacher” Teal Swan has mentioned how death would be relief to her, has a history of self-harm, and suicide attempts. She has suggested to her followers that suicide is an option, while stating, “I’m not going to advocate for suicide.” In response to this statement and more, read the Rebuttal to Teal’s Suicide Segment in “Teal Swan Answers Allegations” video [https://bit.ly/2HdgIat]. She has used inappropriate and suggestive language to convince guests that they are unhappy living, she has glorified death and suicide, projected thoughts, feelings, and beliefs onto guests such as “You are not committed to life”, and once joked about her first client’s suicide that prompted the audience to laugh. As evidenced in Teal’s Facebook group, Teal Tribe, many of her followers are suicidal [https://bit.ly/2EmU0tt], with no qualified training, and support experience - see Suicidal Posts for how Teal handles those who are suicidal in her group [https://bit.ly/2q8p8Zr]. Her teaching methods display her lack of degree, license, specialized training in trauma therapy, nor accountability. None of this behavior is “revolutionary” as she likes to describe herself and her work, it’s irresponsible, if not, dangerous. 

Video Credit: The Suicide Catalyst / A.U.

www.tealswanexposed.com

episodes.title: Teal Swan On Alcoholism - Suicide Contradiction
episodes.description:
In the following clips, "spiritual teacher" Teal Swan misleads her followers by stating that the only source of alcoholism is loneliness, and believes that recovery could be too difficult, and "suicide would be better." She made this statement less than a month before she said that she "does not advocate for suicide."

https://www.TealSwanExposed.com/suicide

episodes.title: Teal Swan's Claim of Being Sewn Into a Corpse
episodes.description:
Accompanying Article: https://bit.ly/2Jkybyi | "Spiritual leader" Teal Swan claims that she was sewn into a human corpse at age 8 for twelve hours. Is this even possible? Cloverdale Funeral Home in Boise, Idaho has this to say about Teal's claim: "No, no, no. I mean, you can imagine, just, anybody can look at their own body [laughs] to figure that one out."

____________

episodes.title: Teal Swan Confuses Followers With Word Salad
episodes.description:
Considering Teal Aggrandizes herself as an omnipotent extrasensory, but plagiarizes, could it be that the guest inadvertently was a mirror for Teal, and so Teal exposed her own inauthenticity? It is concerning that Teal projected her beliefs onto the guest that was not uplifting, confused the guest with over-complicating the judgement of her, and Teal perhaps humiliated her in front of a live audience. Plagiarism: www.tealswanexposed.com/plagiarism
___

More on Teal Swan's word salad:
While Google is Teal’s best friend, she has the notable ability for “word salad” as witnessed in her speaking engagements and in her blogs. It is a “combination of intentional manipulative conversational techniques that are designed to frustrate, confuse, and erode the sanity of the victim by getting them to question their perceptions of events, as well as their own judgment in general.” (MacKenzie). Her guests are oftentimes left perplexed and sometimes even embarrassed and humiliated in front of hundreds of attendees. Teal’s followers will confront those who question Teal’s word salad by stating they just do not have a higher level of spiritual knowledge and understanding yet. Talk about divisive elitism. That should debunk the “teachings” right there due to hypocrisy and contradictions. For examples of confused followers, watch her Synchronization Workshops

episodes.title: Teal Swan Claims She Can't Plug In Devices
episodes.description:
A former member of Teal Swan's "Intentional Community" stated, "Teal is promising that her version of 'real' shadow work is going to cure even the most shell shocked and war torn veterans. Yet somehow, after all this expert shadow work on herself, Teal still feigns being unable to cope with plugging in appliances in her documentary trailer? — For what it’s worth, this is just more performance art for the camera. I personally witnessed Teal plugging in her blow dryer, phone charger, and Fallon’s laptop many times, without so much as a pause while I was living
with her."

It is not ethical for Teal Swan to lift others’ work, and even more concerning, receive royalties for her plagiarized material.

Teal Swan's behavior is a cult characteristic. She feels she's entitled to steal others' work, and is grandiose with her belief that she is revolutionary and a martyr. She places herself on the level of great historical leaders.

https://tealswanblog.wordpress.com/2018/01/07/teal-swan-plagiarism

episodes.title: Teal Swan Solicits Gifts From Students [Read Article For Context]
episodes.description:
Article: https://bit.ly/2uMsOEV | Teal Swan likes to receive gifts. Specifically, she likes to receive them from her “fans” (quotation marks hers, from her blog post,  “Fear Layered Love”). Teal states, "Speaking of love, I went to my company mailbox yesterday. My box was full of presents and letters sent by “fans”. I feel so weird calling people who follow my material fans. It feels more like they are members of my army or like they are extended family members scattered all over the world." Read more: https://bit.ly/2uMsOEV
